text: too much exercise can kill you this is
the best news I've heard all
[Music]
week hey guys terara here for D news
with an interesting new study about
exercise the silent killer now we've
been taught to believe that exercise is
great for us because most of the time it
is but it turns out there's a small
portion of the population who exercises
too much to the point where it may
actually kill them now chances are
you've heard stories about people who
are super healthy run 20 mil every
single day and then all of a sudden boom
they just drop dead out of nowhere most
of the time that's caused by cardiac
hypertrophy which is what happens when
you exercise so much that your heart
muscles get enlarged to the point where
they obstruct your ventricles until
eventually you just die now most of us
don't have to worry about that cuz it
only kills about 100 people per year in
the US and almost all of those people
are insane crazy athletes however a new
study out of Germany finds that
high-intensity exercise puts us at risk
for more than just cardiac hypertrophy
the results which were published in the
journal heart show that people with
existing heart disease who overdose on
high-intensity exercise may actually
increase their risk of death from heart
attack or stroke researchers looked at
over a thousand people who had been
diagnosed with stable coronary artery
heart disease for 10 years or more and
they found that those who complete a
daily strenuous exercise were more than
twice as likely to die of a heart attack
or stroke than people who simply
exercised moderately by contrast people
who didn't exercise at all were four
times more likely to die of a heart
attack or stroke current guidelines say
that heart disease patients should do up
to an hour of moderate activity at least
five times a week which is still in line
with this study although their results
seem to take on a sort of reverse J curb
where no exercise is really really bad
moderate exercise is ideal and too much
exercise is bad but still not as bad as
none at all now it might seem
counterintuitive to think that exercise
could possibly be bad for someone with
heart disease but other Studies have
found similar results endurance training
in particular has been shown to send the
body into an acute inflammatory state
that over time can damage the heart of
course none of this should serve as a
deterrent to exercise unless you're
running marathons every week not
exercising at all still has the worst
possible outcome but the intensity and
duration of the exercise we do are also
things we should be considering what do
you guys think is high-intensity
exercise going to kill us all I can't
say it for sure but I'll tell you this
much it definitely won't kill me cuz I
don't do it as always if you have
thoughts about this episode leave them
in the comments below and for more
videos subscribe here
